survey.description:
This is a generic survey that can be used as the base for assessments of Land Use, Land Use Change and Forestry (LULUCF) that are compliant with the IPCC guidelines.
Notice that you will need to adapt the Land Use Subdivisions ( in the land_use code in the Code Lists view). Please do not change the names/codes of the main categories (Forest, Grassland, Settlement...) only add the right subdivisions to the region/country you are assessing.
This survey is also adapted to be used in conjunction with the ALU software (http://www.nrel.colostate.edu/projects/ALUsoftware/) in order to be able to produce the data for the Land Use segment of a Green House Gas inventory following the IPCC 2006 guidelines.
In this survey there are also elements for evaluating the accessibility of the plots. This survey could be used in a two-phased forest inventory in which for the first phase the accessibility and type of forest is assessed and the second phase (field visit) is designed taking these factors into account.
For more information or questions post a question in the forum : www.openforis.org/support

item.label: Grassland with trees
item.description: Grasslands with up to 10% of tree cover.

item.label: Grassland with shrubs
item.description: Grassland with shrub cover between 2 and 10%.

item.label: Grassland with trees and shrubs
item.description: Grassland with tree cover and shrub cover between 2 and 10%.

item.label: Shrubland
item.description: Grassland with more than 10% of shrubs.

item.label: Shrubland with trees
item.description: Grassland with more than 10% of shrub cover and tree cover between 2 and 10%.

item.label: Village
item.description: Anything that is not town or city

item.label: Infrastructure
item.description: roads, railway, power lines, harbors, airports, landfills, etc.

item.label: Built up
item.description: Buildings, farms, houses, barns, stables, etc.

list.name: ecological_zones
list.label: Ecological zone
Ecological zones
list.description: These are the default FAO GEZ ( download here: http://www.fao.org/geonetwork/srv/en/resources.get?id=47105&fname=gez2010.zip&access=private - more info http://www.fao.org/docrep/017/ap861e/ap861e00.pdf ) ecological zones that are used as the standard classes in the GHG inventory software ALU (http://www.nrel.colostate.edu/projects/ALUsoftware/).

list.name: land_use_subcategory
list.label: Land Use Sub-category
Sub-Categories
list.description: These indicate the possible combinations of Land Use conversions

item.label: Grass
item.description: This category includes alfa (and of course meadow and lawn, etc.)

item.label: Bushes/Shrubs
item.description: This category includes: cactus, pastoral plantation, maquis, etc.

item.label: Built up
item.description: Urban areas, villages, hamlets, farms, single houses

item.label: Infrastructures
item.description: Roads, Railways, Airports, Ports, Electricity generation, Mining. Any human structures used for industry, transport or productive (non agricultural) use.

item.label: Water Body
item.description: River, Lake, Water Reservois, Dams, Lagoons, Swamp

item.label: No Very High Resolution Imagery available

list.name: soil_types
list.label: Soil Types
list.description: Soil classes that are consistent with the IPCC defaults expected by ALU. You can obtain this data from : http://www.isric.org/content/download-form?dataset=CBP_Global_IPCC_soil_classes_2010Nov04.zip

item.label: No Data
item.description: The map contains no data for this plot

list.name: climate_zones
list.label: Climate Zone
list.description: These are the IPCC default climate zones as expected by the ALU tool, the dataset that can be used is hosted at http://esdac.jrc.ec.europa.eu/projects/renewable-energy-directive

spatialReferenceSystem.label: EPSG:4326
spatialReferenceSystem.description: EPSG:World Geodetic System 1984 Horizontal component of 3D system. Used by the GPS satellite navigation system and for NATO military geodetic surveying.
spatialReferenceSystem.wkt: GEOGCS["WGS 84", DATUM["World Geodetic System 1984", SPHEROID["WGS 84", 6378137.0, 298.257223563, AUTHORITY["EPSG","7030"]], AUTHORITY["EPSG","6326"]], PRIMEM["Greenwich", 0.0, AUTHORITY["EPSG","8901"]], UNIT["degree", 0.017453292519943295], AXIS["Geodetic longitude", EAST], AXIS["Geodetic latitude", NORTH], AUTHORITY["EPSG","4326"]]

boolean.name: land_use_category_accuracy
boolean.label: Land Use Category 2020 - Confidence
boolean.description: Is the user confident that the assessed Land Use category is the actual Land Use on the plot?

boolean.name: land_use_category_has_changed
boolean.label: Land Use Category Has Changed
Catégorie d'utilisation des terres a changé
boolean.description: This is a calculated field that helps us to keep truck if the LU category has changed or not
Ceci est un champ calculé qui nous aide à garder l'information si la catégorie LU a changé ou pas pour la placette

boolean.name: land_use_subcategory_accuracy
boolean.label: Land Use Conversion - Confidence
boolean.description: Is the user confident that the assessed Land Use conversion is correct?

code.name: land_use_subcategory_year_of_change
code.label: Land Use Change - Year of change

code.name: site_accessibility
code.label: Accessibility
code.description: This is used to measure the difficulty for a field visit to the plot. Use the ruler tool in Google Earth to measure the distance to the closest point of access.

code.name: tree_count
code.label: Tree Count
Nombre d'arbres
code.description: Count the number of trees inside the plot
Compter le nombre d'arbres dans la placette

check.message: If there is tree cover you must specify the number of trees

entity.name: land_cover
entity.label: Elements in the plot - Latest image

check.message: The sum of the Land Cover elements must be more than 90%

code.name: disturbance_type
code.label: Type of Disturbance
Disturbance - Type
code.description: Are there any human induced or natural disturbances in the plot?

code.name: disturbance_grade
code.label: Grade
Distrubance - Grade
code.description: Grade of the human impact, this is only relevant for Forest, Grassland, Wetland and Otherland plots.

code.name: fire_year
code.label: Fire - Year of the last fire

code.name: imagery_available
code.label: Imagery available
code.description:
What type of VHR imagery is available?
In case of Google Earth imagery being available for the site then choose Google Earth. Otherwise choose the other sources.

date.name: rs_date
date.label: Latest Imagery date
date.description: You can see the date of the image in the bottom of the Google Earth frame.

check.message: Initial and previous land use subdivisions cannot be the same

text.name: plot_file
text.label: CSV file that contains the plot

default.expr: format-number(ceiling(elevation div 100 ), '#')

text.name: comments
text.label: Comments
text.description: Here you can write any remarks about the plot that will make the review process easier. Try to add information about land use change.

text.name: land_use_subdivision_combination
text.label: Land Use Subdivision Combination
Combinaison de subdivision d'utilisation des terres

default.expr: concat( land_use_initial_subdivision, land_use_subdivision)

boolean.name: land_use_change_once
boolean.label: Land Use Change at least Once
Changement d'affection des terres au moins une fois

default.expr: land_use_category_has_changed or land_use_subdivision_change

boolean.name: second_lu_change
boolean.label: Ha habido otro cambio anteriormente?
Has there been a previous land use?
Y a-t-il eu une utilisation antérieure des terres
boolean.description: Has the land use change more than once since 2000? For instance this might happen if there is a transition from Forest in 2000 to Grassland in 2005 that becomes settlement in 2010.

L’utilisation des terres a-t-elle changé plusieurs fois depuis 2000? Par exemple, cela pourrait se produire s'il y a une transition de Terre forestière en 2000 à Prairie en 2005 qui devient Etablissement en 2010.

code.name: land_use_initial_category_alias
code.label: ALU Land Use Before Current
ALU Utilisation des terres avant celle courante

code.name: second_lu_conversion
code.label: Conversion UT anterior al ultimo cambio
Oldest Land Use
Utilisation des terres la plus ancienne

code.name: second_lu_conversion_year
code.label: Año de conversion anterior al último cambio
Year of the conversion from the oldest land use
Année du changement d'AT le plus ancien
code.description: If the dynamic is Forest -> 2005 Grassland ->2010 Settlement, then here you would set 2005.
Si la dynamique est Foret en 2005, Prairie en 2010 et ensuite Etablissements, il faudra saisir 2005

compare.message: El año delcambio ha de ser anterior al primer año de cambio registrado

text.name: land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination
text.label: Land Use Oldest Subdivision Combination
Combinaison de Subdivision de l'UT la plus ancienne

default.expr: concat( second_lu_subdivision, land_use_initial_subdivision)

boolean.name: validate_oldest_luc
boolean.label: Validate Oldest LUC
Valider l' UT la plus ancienne

default.expr: land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLPBL' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLSBL' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLPLANTF' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLREGFOR' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLSHIFTAGR' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLINTAGR' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLSAVG' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLSHRUB' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLPAST' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLFOLL' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLREGBUSH' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLFTG' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLCS' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLTOWN' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLVS' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLOS' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLRS' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLMS' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLAQC' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLIS' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLWL' or land_use_oldest_subdivision_combination ='PBLIWB'

code.name: second_lu_subdivision
code.label: Subdivision UT inicial
Oldest Land Use Subdivision
La subdivision d'UT la plus ancienne

check.message: The oldest land use subdivision must be different than the first change
